Package it.polimi.ingsw.game_model.utils

Class CalculatorInfluence

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.game_model.utils.CalculatorInfluence
public class CalculatorInfluence extends Object
Class used to calculate the player's influence on an island: influence is an integer which depends on towers on islands and students on island whose professor is in the player's game board.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CalculatorInfluence()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Optional<Player>
    evaluate(List<Player> players, Island island)
    If the game's rules include teams of players this function evaluates team influence: at first it creates teams from the list of players; for each team(a list of players with the same color) it evaluates the team influence which will be the sum of each team member's influence; then it compares each team's influence, in case it founds a most influencing team, return the list of players of the most influencing team; in case of a draw(no team has a unique maximal value of influence), it frees the current island and returns an empty player list.
    int
    evaluateForPlayer(Player player, Island island)
    Sum tower influence and student influence of the player
    private List<List<Player>>
    getListsOfPlayersWithSameColor(List<Player> players)
    Given a list of players, for each player in the list creates a group of players with the same tower color

    protected int
    playerTowerInfluence(Player player, Island island)
    Given a player and an island of the board, returns the influence given by the control of any tower on that island.

    • evaluateForPlayer

      public int evaluateForPlayer(Player player, Island island)
      Sum tower influence and student influence of the player
      Parameters:
      player - player associated with influence
      island - island where to calculate influence
      Returns:
      influence

    • evaluate

      public Optional<Player> evaluate(List<Player> players, Island island)
      If the game's rules include teams of players this function evaluates team influence: at first it creates teams from the list of players; for each team(a list of players with the same color) it evaluates the team influence which will be the sum of each team member's influence; then it compares each team's influence, in case it founds a most influencing team, return the list of players of the most influencing team; in case of a draw(no team has a unique maximal value of influence), it frees the current island and returns an empty player list.
      Parameters:
      players - list of players in the game
      island - island where to calculate influence
      Returns:
      list of player if not draw, else an empty players list

    • playerTowerInfluence

      protected int playerTowerInfluence(Player player, Island island)
      Given a player and an island of the board, returns the influence given by the control of any tower on that island.

      For example, if pl equals the white player, and the island has size equals to 1 with a White Tower built on it, then the method returns 1.
      Otherwise, if the island is bigger (aggregation of 2 or more islands), it means that there are more than one tower to be counted (according to our implementation choices, exactly the size of the island).

      Returns:
      the additional influence brought by towers on a specific island for a specific player

    • playerStudentInfluence

      protected int playerStudentInfluence(Player player, Island island)
      Given a player and an island of the board, calculate the influence brought by the students on the island itself.

      A student of a specific color, counts as 1 during the influence calculation for the player who owns the corresponding teachers.
      This method returns the influence the specified player has by counting, according to the rule mentioned before, the sum of all the students whose corresponding teacher are owned by that player.

      Returns:
      the total influence brought by the students whose teachers are controlled by the specified player

    • getListsOfPlayersWithSameColor

      private List<List<Player>> getListsOfPlayersWithSameColor(List<Player> players)
      Given a list of players, for each player in the list creates a group of players with the same tower color
      Parameters:
      players - list of total players
      Returns:
      a list of players with the same tower color
